intro: Mimulus yecorensis, commonly known as the Yecora monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Phrymaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Mimulus yecorensis is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
